records.location_details: On the morning of 09 March 2022, one Frontex [redacted] assigned to [redacted] witnessed the interception of two migrants that had crossed the border from Belarus to Lithuania. The two migrants were redirected to Belarus by Lithuanian border guards in application of Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights
Article 4 of Protocol 4 to the European Convention on Human Rights
art. 18 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 19 (2) of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: Two migrants who crossed the border from Belarus to Lithuania were intercepted by Lithuanian border guards, witnessed by Frontex personnel, and subsequently returned to Belarus under Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021. The report identifies potential fundamental rights violations including inhuman and degrading treatment, collective expulsion, right to asylum, and non-refoulement. The assessment section discusses concerns regarding effective access to asylum procedures, individual vulnerability assessments, and the prohibition of non-refoulement at the Lithuania-Belarus border, concluding that the Lithuanian authorities' practices may not align with international and EU obligations.
records.evidence_quote: on the morning of 09 March 2022, one Frontex [...] witnessed the interception of two migrants that had crossed the border from Belarus to Lithuania. The two migrants were redirected to Belarus by Lithuanian border guards in application of Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021.
